Title: Projecting Individual Fields
DescriptionLines: **Projections** are used in a query when you need to **retrieve only specific document fields** from the server, instead of the whole, full document.
(When projections are Not defined - the full document content is returned).
This reduces the amount of data sent over the network and is useful when only partial data is needed.
The returned entities field names can be customized to suit your needs.
The output projected entities returned by the query are Not tracked by the Session, as they are Not full documents.
Projections are applied at the last stage in the query pipeline - after documents have been processed, filtered, sorted and paged.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define a query
DescriptionLines: * Define a query on the 'Companies' collection Using the Session `Query()` LINQ method syntax.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define a projection
DescriptionLines: * Use `Select()` to project partial document data from the server, instead of the full 'Company' document.
* The entities returned by the query will have the structure of the custom class 'CompanyDetails'.
Data for fields _CompanyName_ , _City_ & _Country_ will be retrieved from the selected specified document fields.
* Calling Select() does Not trigger any index creation.

Walkthroughs.Title: Execute the query
DescriptionLines: * The 'projectedQuery' variable only stores the query definition.
* The 'projectedResults' variable will hold the resulting matching entities.
* The output projected entities returned by the query are Not tracked by the Session,
as they are not full documents.
* Any change made to these entities will Not be sent to the server upon calling SaveChanges().
